pdp_listing_detail.p3_summary_title: Cozy entire apartment near Korea Town, UofT.

photos.caption: The big comfortable sofa-bed is waiting for one person
Another angle of the queen size bed
Remote to control the floor lamp(color and brightness)
Dining area and fridge, two more chairs are in the closet
Washroom with shampoo, body wash, toothpaste, bath towels, hair dryer, lotion included

primary_host.about:
If you can make someone special, that is immense; that can hardly be explained. 
Nothing gives you joy like making someone happy.
That is, I think, the reason which motivates me to be a host.
Being a host, it's not a very casual decision, being a host is a responsibility.
Canada is a very multicultural country.
My objective is, if someone comes here they should be connected to the place in the right way.
Me, as a host, I think is kind of connecting these different dots together, a kind of narrator.
Someone told me, a guest,"I may have a lot of things, but actually the high point of my stay was how you made me feel"
we have a thousand years old scripture:"有朋自远方来,不亦乐乎(How happy we are, to have friends from afar! )"
My guests trust me and I trust them. And that's the reason it works.
So, hospitality, if you ask me, is about taking care, it's about welcoming, it's about welcoming with open heart.
My name is Frank Liu, and I'm an international student, and 

I am an Airbnb host.
primary_host.name: Frank

sectioned_description.access:
Fully stocked kitchen, with a 4 burner gas stove, large modern oven, microwave, cutlery and flatware provided

Bedrooms: Queen size bed, Large wardrobe closet, new desk, and chair.
Sofa Bed

Shampoo, body wash, bath towels and toothpaste included in the washroom.
sectioned_description.description:
Newly renovated cozy apartment located in a quiet and convenient downtown neighborhood. 100 meters from Bloor street. 2-minute-walking distance from Bathurst subway station. Near Korea town, Casa Loma Castle, University of Toronto's downtown campus, Royal Ontario Museum and Little Italy.

A variety of restaurants, banks, coffee shops and dollar/convenience stores located within walking distance.

This is a small basement apartment of a traditional home. It is completely self-contained with separate entrance. The apartment has a fully stocked kitchen, a dining area, own private washroom, and a spacious bedroom.

The bedroom has a queen size bed plus a sofa bed that sleeps one big guy comfortably.

No TV in the unit

Fully stocked kitchen, with a 4 burner gas stove, large modern oven, microwave, cutlery and flatware provided

Bedrooms: Queen size bed, Large wardrobe closet, new desk, and chair.
Sofa Bed

Shampoo, body wash, bath towels and toothpaste included in the washroom.

We utilize a simple self check in/check out procedure so you can enjoy the privacy and flexibility you need. 
If you have any problem with your stay, you can easily reach me by phone or messages. I also reside in the rooms upstairs if you prefer to communicate in person.

Things to do:
FOOD: Taste the world within a 5-minute walk from home. Local restaurants include Arisu Korean BBQ and Sushi, Read Thailand Cuisine, Pizza, Ghazale Middle Eastern Restaurant, Aroma Expresso Bar, Paupers Pub, Country Style Hungarian Restaurant and much more 

GAMES:—Snakes and Lattes— A coffee shop/restaurant with a mass collection of games to play on the spot or to purchase and take home. If you want to play alone no worries! Games range from one person games to multiplayer games

BOOKS:—Toronto Palmerston Public Library—The public library is right across the street. It includes printed books, audiobooks, in English-Korean, French and Spanish.

GYM: Toronto is an amazing city with a variety of fun workouts from the regular gym, to Barre, Pilates, Yoga, indoor Surfing, indoor obstacle course, trampoline workouts, Salsa dancing, pole dancing, Thai boxing and much more all accessible by our local transit, TTC.

NAIL, HAIR & SPA: A variety of nail, hair and spa services within 10-minute walking distance located in Korea town

From airport to my house (Pearson airport)
Take UP express train to Bloor station, and then transfer to Subway named Dundas west, 
Take subway Bloor line eastbound (Dundas West to Bathurst)
Get off the metro through the Markham exit
1 min walk.

From train station to my house (Union station)
Take subway University line northbound (Union to St. George station)
Transfer to Bloor line westbound (St. Geroge station to Bathurst station)
Get off the metro through the Markham exit
1 min walk to my house from the station

From Greyhound station to my house(Coach Terminal)
Walk East to Dundas subway station
Take Yonge line northbound (Dundas to Bloor)
Take Bloor line westbound (Bloor Station to Bathurst Station)
Get off the metro through the Markham exit
1 min walk to my house from the station

Parking
There are two options for parking. 
1. There is a public parking lot just around the corner from our house that charges hourly. 
Day Maximum(7am-6pm) cost $10; Night Maximum(6pm-7am)  cost $6.
2. Another slightly more economical option is to purchase a parking permit from the city. Then you can park on the street in front of our house. 
Simply google Toronto Temporary On-Street Parking and apply. It will cost you $9.48 plus tax for 24 hours, $14.22 plus tax for 48hours or $22.21 plus tax for 7 days

This is a basement unit, if you are over 6'2, you might feel confined.
As we do have people living upstairs, some light noise from people walking around should be expected. Also, we are located close to the subway station. Although it is convenient, you can hear the occasional humming when subway passes through.
sectioned_description.house_rules: Take off your shoes when you enter the unit. Slippers are provided.
